XR Chest 1 V Portable DR

INDICATION: Chest pain

COMPARISON: December 23, 2022


TECHNIQUE: Frontal radiograph the chest

FINDINGS: Right lower lobe greater than left lower lobe pulmonary opacities
consistent with pneumonia. Heart and osseous structures are unremarkable.

IMPRESSION: Moderately developed right basilar and probable left basilar pneumonia.
Possibility of aspiration pneumonitis should be considered.
***** Final *****

DOB: 06/23/1973
History Number:1178537
EXAM: Ventilation Perfusion Scan
REASON: DYSPNEA, HX OF PE
RADIOPHARMACEUTICAL: 10  mCi of xenon-133 gas was inhaled by the patient for the ventilation portion of the examination. 6.2 mCi of Tc 99m MAA was administered IV per protocol for the perfusion portion of the examination.

COMPARISON STUDY: Chest x-ray 10/28/2019.

FINDINGS: 
Ventilation images were obtained in the single breath, equilibrium and washout phases and show mostly uniform distribution of xenon radiotracer throughout bilateral lung fields, with slight decreased ventilation in the left lower lobe, correlating to area of previously noted basilar atelectasis. There is no evidence of air trapping. Perfusion images show symmetric and uniform radiotracer uptake throughout bilateral lung fields with slight decreased perfusion in the left lower lobe, corresponding to ventilation defect. No evidence of mismatched segmental perfusion defects.

IMPRESSION:

VERY LOW PROBABILITY VENTILATION/PERFUSION SCAN FOR PULMONARY EMBOLISM.

-- 
 
 
  I have personally reviewed the image(s) and the resident interpretation and agree with the findings.

PLAT-27-62

Procedure Code: MRBRNWW
Procedure: MR-BRAIN W-WO CONTRA
Reason for Study: bilateral carotid bruits

Procedure:  MR-BRAIN W-WO CONTRA

Clinical Indication:  bilateral carotid bruits

Sagittal and axial T1, FLAIR, T2 and gradient axial and diffusion weighted
imaging was performed, followed by axial and coronal T1-weighted post contrast
imaging:

Contrast: 15 ml Multihance (Gadolinium) intravenous.

COMPARISON: CT head 1/9/2021

Mild generalized cerebral atrophy. Relatively symmetric scattered foci of
increased T2 and FLAIR weighted signal are present in the periventricular and
hemispheric white matter consistent with residua of remote microvascular
ischemic and/or nonspecific demyelination changes.

Diffusion weighted images are without abnormally increased signal intensity to
suggest acute ischemia.

No findings of acute hemorrhage.

No abnormal extra-axial fluid collections are present.

No hydrocephalus.

No midline shift.

The pituitary gland demonstrates normal size, contour and signal.

The cerebellopontine angles are symmetric.

The brainstem and cervical cord junction is without abnormality.

The cerebellar tonsils are not abnormally low-lying.

The bilateral globes and orbits are without abnormality.

No significant paranasal sinus disease.

IMPRESSION:
1. No pathologic lesion or acute abnormality was identified.
2. Chronic white matter changes.







Created and Electronically Signed By Dr Chad Niles, MD on 7/25/2022 11:21 AM

HISTORY:  Pain

COMPARISON: None.

TECHNIQUE: Routine duplex venous Doppler of the bilateral lower extremities 
is
performed with B-mode/2-D grayscale imaging of the vascular structures 
followed
by color Doppler study with color flow, spectral analysis, and 
compressibility.

FINDINGS: Bilateral common femoral, greater saphenous vein junction, femoral,
popliteal and posterior tibial veins are normal in caliber with no filling
defects.

Color Doppler studies show normal color-flow and a flow spectrum. There is
normal compressibility in all checking points. There is no evidence of deep
venous thrombosis.

IMPRESSION:
No evidence of DVT of the bilateral lower extremities.
